intro: Adipera spiciflora, commonly known as the spikeflower mallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its sparsely branched stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Adipera spiciflora is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
